instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2610: What is 820-2610? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.D6905: What is D6905? Diode sitting between PPBUS_G3H/PP18V5 charger voltage and PP3V42_G3H power supply input on very old Macbooks(before 2011), can die and cause PP3V42_G3H to be missing and have no input voltage. .
definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2610</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no battery
threads.message:
Arrived recognizing and charging the battery but wouldn't run off the battery. Replaced <DIODE>D6905</DIODE> off of a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> and now no green light.

PP3V42 3.42  <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 8.4v

<SIGNAL>ONEWIRE_EN</SIGNAL> on <TRANSISTOR>Q6915</TRANSISTOR> now 0v

Should  <CHIP>U6915</CHIP> be replaced next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2610</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no battery
threads.message: Whitout checking its voltages, at least?
